For TAR UMT, you can apply online via the Admissions Portal. Entry requirements vary by programme and may include academic results, MUET, portfolios, or interviews. More info: https://www.tarc.edu.my/admissions/

TAR UMT offers Pre-University, Diploma, Undergraduate, and Postgraduate programmes across faculties such as Engineering, Business, Computing & IT, Built Environment, Communication, Creative Arts, Hospitality, and Social Science. For the full list, visit https://www.tarc.edu.my/

patterns: How much is the tuition fee?
responses: Tuition fees vary by programme and level of study. As a guideline, diploma and degree fees at TAR UMT are very affordable compared to other private institutions in Malaysia. For the latest breakdown, check: https://www.tarc.edu.my/admissions/

patterns: Does TAR UMT offer financial aid?
responses: Yes! TAR UMT offers scholarships such as the TARC‚ÄìTAA Scholarships, merit awards, and need-based bursaries. For details and eligibility criteria, visit: https://www.tarc.edu.my/admissions/scholarships-financial-aid/
TAR UMT has its Main Campus in Kuala Lumpur and branch campuses in Penang, Perak, Johor, Pahang, and Sabah.

The Main Library at TAR UMT KL Campus is open on weekdays and Saturdays, with extended hours during exam periods. Facilities include study spaces, online resources, and book lending. Please check the Library‚Äôs official page for exact hours: https://web.tarc.edu.my/library/

patterns: How do I apply for housing?
responses: TAR UMT provides hostel accommodation at its main and selected branch campuses. Students can apply during admission or through the Student Affairs Department. More info: https://www.tarc.edu.my/student-affairs/hostel-accommodation/

patterns: How do I contact TAR UMT?

TAR UMT, established in 1969 as TAR College and upgraded in 2013 as TAR University College, became Tunku Abdul Rahman University of Management and Technology in 2022. It is one of Malaysia‚Äôs oldest and most affordable private institutions, with a strong reputation for quality education.
Exam schedules are released by the Examination Unit each semester. Please check the TAR UMT Academic Calendar or Student Portal for the latest exam dates.

Orientation week for new students is usually held before the start of classes each semester. Activities include campus tours, student society showcases, and briefings by faculty. Dates are announced on the TAR UMT website and Student Portal.
